data.title: Rob Eastwood on LinkedIn: #news #update #localnews #radionews #morningnews
data.meta_description:
Good Thursday morning from WHKY in Hickory, N.C. and welcome to February! 

Radio local news now begins at 5:00 on 102.3 FM, 1290 AM and online atâ€¦
data.text:
Experience the Pulse of Our Community in Episode 2 of Where The People Meet TV! Filmed on historical land at 2715 Hurd in Evanston on May 19th, this episode is a treasure trove of insights and inspiration! Former Governor Pat Quinn joins us to discuss the critical importance of civic engagement and resident participation in local governance. He drops invaluable gems about the upcoming local and national electionsâ€”information every voter needs. Patti Capouch delves deep into the nuances of mental health, providing essential perspectives that touch the heart of our community. And donâ€™t miss Donovan Mixon, who brings the vibrant arts scene of the North Shore to life right before your eyes! Take Action: Your Voice Matters! Do you believe that major decisions impacting your community should be in the hands of all its residents, not just a select few? Reach out to your Alderperson and Mayor today. Ask them if they support giving residents a vote on crucial issues. Itâ€™s time to speak up and ensure your voice is heard! Whether you have time for the full episode or just a few moments for highlights, visit our Patreon page (link in the first comment) to catch all the action. Find out where weâ€™ll be recording next and how you can join us in these crucial times. Stay tuned for Episode 3 - it's coming soon and you won't want to miss it! Join us, and let's navigate these crucial times together! #WhereThePeopleMeetTV #CommunityEngagement #EvanstonHistory #LocalElections #MentalHealthAwareness #ArtCommunity #Episode2 #YourVoiceMatters
